definitions.definition: clean (an area) by brushing away dirt or litter.
examples: I've swept the floor

definitions.definition: move or remove (dirt or litter) by sweeping.
examples: she swept the tea leaves into a dustpan

definitions.definition: move or push (someone or something) with great force.
examples: I was swept along by the crowd
synonyms: tow "he was swept out to sea"

definitions.definition: brush (hair) back from one's face or upward.
examples: long hair swept up into a high chignon

definitions.definition: search (an area) for something.
examples: the detective swept the room for hair and fingerprints

definitions.definition: examine (a place or thing) for electronic listening devices.
examples: the line is swept every fifteen minutes

definitions.definition: cover (an entire area) with a gun.
examples: they were trying to get the Lewis gun up behind some trees from where they would sweep the trench

definitions.definition: move swiftly and smoothly.
examples: a large black car swept past the open windows

definitions.definition: cause to move swiftly and smoothly.
examples: he swept his hand around the room

definitions.definition: (of a person) move in a confident and stately manner.
examples: she swept magnificently from the hall

definitions.definition: (of a geographical or natural feature) extend continuously in a particular direction, especially in a curve.
examples: green forests swept down the hillsides

definitions.definition: affect (an area or place) swiftly and widely.
examples: the rebellion had swept through all four of the country's provinces

definitions.definition: win all the games in (a series); take each of the winning or main places in (a contest or event).
examples: we knew we had to sweep these three home games

definitions.definition: an act of sweeping something with a brush.
examples: I was giving the floor a quick sweep

definitions.definition: short for chimney sweep.
a long, swift, curving movement.
examples: a grandiose sweep of his hand
synonyms: movement "a great sweep of his hand"

definitions.definition: the movement of a beam across the screen of a cathode ray tube.
a comprehensive search or survey of a place or area.
examples: the police finished their sweep through the woods

definitions.definition: a survey of the ratings of broadcast stations, carried out at regular intervals to determine advertising rates.
a long, typically curved stretch of road, river, country, etc.
examples: we could see a wide sweep of country perhaps a hundred miles across
synonyms: plain "a long sweep of golden sand"

definitions.definition: a curved part of a driveway in front of a building.
examples: one fork of the driveway continued on to the gravel sweep

definitions.definition: the range or scope of something.
examples: the whole sweep of the history of the USSR
synonyms: extent "the broad sweep of our interests"

definitions.definition: a sweepstake.
an instance of winning every event, award, or place in a contest.
examples: a World Series sweep

definitions.definition: a long heavy oar used to row a barge or other vessel.
examples: a big, heavy sweep oar

definitions.definition: a sail of a windmill.
a long pole mounted as a lever for raising buckets from a well.
